alert.note: Alert for Clarke; Monroe; Washington (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued January 04 at 1:48AM CST until January 04 at 2:30AM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mobile has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern Monroe County in south central Alabama... Central Washington County in southwestern Alabama... Central Clarke County in southwestern Alabama... * Until 230 AM CST. * At 148 AM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Tibbie to 9 miles southeast of Chatom to 7 miles east of Deer Park to 3 miles north of Citronelle, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Jackson, Grove Hill, Chatom, Saint Stephens, Wagarville, Leroy, Whatley, Tibbie and McIntosh. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CST for south central and southwestern Alabama. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CST for south central and southwestern Alabama.
